Who would have a meltdown over {problem}?

action: benefit the most from their policies

scenario: {playerRefs} just got put in charge of {locations}
{playerRefs} somehow ended up in charge of {eventTypes}

apocalypse: In the case of nuclear war
A global pandemic wipes out 90% of the population
action: be prepared with a doomsday bunker
screw over the group by stealing all the food
betray the group for their own survival
get into a screaming match with their GPS
yell at an automated phone system for 20 minutes
have a full meltdown at a parking meter
argue with Siri/Alexa like it's a real person
threaten their printer during a paper jam

templates.pattern: Demands to speak to the manager over {issue}
If put in charge of {locations}, whose rules would be the most ridiculous?

action: become addicted to being in charge of anything
turn into a dictator over something trivial
create unnecessarily complicated rules for no reason
start a rebellion over something stupid
do the exact opposite of what they're told
break rules just to prove a point

action: quit their job dramatically and immediately regret it

telling their boss to fuck off

action: Read your last text out loud

challengeModeTemplates.pattern: Truth or Dare: Who would most likely {action}?

playerRefs: the person wearing the brightest shirt
the person who laughed most recently

timeFrames: in the middle of the night

categoryDisplayNames.theGoodTheBadTheUgly: The Good, The Bad, & The Ugly

categoryDescriptions.firstWorldProblems: Mundane, privileged inconveniences of modern living.
categoryDescriptions.breakingTheRules: Cheeky defiance of authority, wild dares, and rebellious actions.
categoryDescriptions.theTruthComesOut: Secret habits, embarrassing moments, and confessions nobody wants to admit.
categoryDescriptions.spicyConfessions: Intimate and risqué topics that push boundaries.
categoryDescriptions.theGoodTheBadTheUgly: The best, worst, and most questionable personality traits.
categoryDescriptions.thePeopleWeTolerate: Unspoken rules and awkward experiences with friends and frenemies.
categoryDescriptions.romanceAndRelationships: Love, dating, hookups, and relationship drama.
categoryDescriptions.dollarsAndSense: Money, wealth, status, and how we value ourselves and others.
